“Like shit” came your carefully formulated response. “Well, that’s to be expected I suppose” he chuckled. “You had a burning building fall on you, you’re lucky to be alive.” “A building?” “Yes your shop collapsed on you.”

You close your eyes. Your shop was gone, you had nothing. “How long will I be in here?”

“Well despite everything you managed to avoid any serious injury, only a few scrapes and burns. You’ll be good to go tomorrow.” The man smiled “Your extremely lucky”

You grimaced weakly, and tried to fall asleep.

You woke up a few hours later despite the quiet you had a distinct feeling of being watched. You opened your eyes; the room was empty allowing you to get a better look. There was a desk, covered in medical tools, a cabinet filled with small vials, and a dragon sitting in the corner.

“You’re awake.” The voice was the same as the one from your store earlier. “You’re the dragon who came to my shop.” “Yes, and I came to apologize.”

“Why would you apologize?” “Well those gems were charged with a great deal of magical energy, when you cast a spell the power from the gems overcharged it, causing an explosion” she said sadly. While you were initially angry it soon faded.
“It’s not your fault” she looked up shocked “What?” “It’s not your fault, you didn’t know that I used magic to forge” “but if I had told you what the gems-“ “You had no reason to tell me, don’t beat yourself up over it.”

No is what you want to say, but really, what would be the fun in that? "Nope, nothing"


The walk back to the city is blessedly short, you don't want to hang around Kara more then necessary, less she find a way to get what she wants. As you both reach the entrance gate you hastily leave you single minded ^friend^ and depart alone for the job master place.

Your mind, or perhaps your conscience, keep reminding you on how sad Kara looked upon your departure from her company for the whole walk, and every time you remind your conscience to shut it, you know that she was just acting, or at least you strongly believe so. When the job board at the side of the building finally become visible, you are finally able to completely suppress your non existent guilt and push yourself forward at the thoughts of the money you are finally going to collect the fruit of your labor, or at least the 25% of it

Having to give credits where is due it's hard sometimes, after all with your agreement with Nariza both you and Kara get only the 50% of the reward, and of course 25% of it go to your far too friendly dragoness, so...

Also, no way you count what Kara has done as a favor, you never asked for her help even if she gave it, so you rightfully give her half what you are getting for the job, or at least leave it here on her name for when she will undoubtedly come for whatever reason. But that's it, nothing more, hopefully that whatever is not trying to contact you

Reaching the door of the job master completely undeterred you rapidly knock at his door, the answer come as a red dragon in it's reduced form open the door for you

"Yes?"

Well you expected something more from him, it, his whatever, something like a stream of fire or...nah, you are still too conditioned from your past experience you remind yourself

"I was looking for the job master, i have important information regarding the incident at the arena"

Of course you don't even bother asking what a dragon is doing in the job master office, with how your day has gone so far, little care for such meaningless details remain

The voice of the job master is clearly audible being the reduced dragon "Do come in Aranos, i was waiting for you"

Was he now? Curious, maybe he suspect or even already know most of the information gained from your last endeavor. The dragon step aside and let you in closing the door behind you with a boom, they should really tweak that sound enchantment spell

As the first time you was here the rune on the floor pulse gently before letting you pass. The job master seems nervous about something, and you probably know why.

"I heard of your return Aranos, i confide you have news about" he pause for a moment "this mess"

You nod "Yes, a black dragoness named Karat-Karasomething, will come here shortly with the coffer, we didn't opened it of course"

He nod, a small smile return to his stressed face "Ah yes, Karathiana. I know her, she worked for us in the past and she always proved herself reliable, if a little single minded sometimes"

He don't say "Well yes, it's definitely her. Half my reward go to her, the other 50% go to a dragoness named Nazira, a blue one, she too seems to be quite single minded if you ask me, i instead bring information on who in behind all of this"

The job muster chuckle "For one that didn't wanted to have anything to do with dragons, you keep quite the company"

A deep chuckle remind you of the presence of the red one still at the door. You shrug "What can i say, i have a magnetic personality; sometimes you pick your battles, sometimes they pick you. I couldn't really choose at the time. Now to business, ehm"

You make sign of a pen writing and the job master understand what you mean, he take out the contract and begin to count the money he owe you, or better say the city owe you "It was the cult of rage that stoled the coffer, the order was given by a certain Razim"

The job master eyes widen for a moment as the money he was counting fall from his hands, he recover his composure quickly but it's too late to feign ignorance at this point, you continue

"I do not know why The Father of the Cult of Rage stole specifically that coffer, as i had not opened it, but i do know it was a trap for the same man your guard captain was sent to arrest for the damage at the arena and the subsequent chaos derived from it. Do please give the rest of the money to the one i mentioned earlier, i believe they will come soon, for a reason or another"

The job master steal a glance at the dragon at the door, you heard him walking at your side, then the Job master nervously ask "How much do you know about the cults, Aranos?"

You don't like his tone, nor the closeness of the red one "Not much, enough to not get involved but really, i only know that the cults are ancient and that they was somewhat responsible for the fall of the old empires, their cultist are fiercely loyal but that probably because their mind is practically rewritten, or at least the one considered less useful are, but little else"

The job master sigh "Do you want me to being honest with you, Aranos?"

No, knowing mean blamable, you wish to remain blissfully ignorant about anything that doesn't regard you directly or your job "I rather not, i do not have the habits of involving myself with local politics, and frankly neither should you. If the cultist bother you, erase them"

The red dragon nod eagerly and speak heatedly "My thoughts exactly, we already know some citizen are actively supporting a cult, we should make an example of them, no one should think even for a moment that compromising the security of this city is a viable option"

The job master sign to him to calm down "We will intervene at the right moment ambassador, i somewhat agree with both of you but what we need here is tactfulness not strength. At the right moment we will strike swiftly and decisively"

The dragon sbuff "I hope so"

You look at the desk and see all the money counted and ready for taking, must have been distracted by their talking for not have noticed it sooner. You reach for the self-sustaining pen, that magically take the exact quantity ink from a near bottle of ink, and sign under the contract name, a standard procedure you repeated every time a job like this is completed, then take the money in your now pleasantly heavier purse.

As you get up the dragon speak with amusement evident in hir tone "Aranos if i may, i know that adventuring may give you...interesting experiences, but walking around the city smelling like an aroused female may not being in your best interest"

Your eyes widen as you remember Kara advances, the job master laugh "Also Aranos, do remember that red dragon are hermaphrodite, so..."

The red one playfully use hir tail to touch your groin as he turn around and keep hir appendage hight to show you the lips hidden beneath. Despite knowing that shi was joking, or at least you hope so, you quickly abandon the place and walk at a brisk peace toward the inn, a shower never seemed more necessary right now

1412111222211211221111.content:
Reaching the inn took significantly less time then you remembered, perhaps it has something to do with your brisker walking peace, or perhaps it's just wanting to have a moment for yourself, as you still had to find any since your arrival in this strange city

Opening the now familiar door of the inn mange to give you a sober sense of calmness that you haven't felt in a while, but then again sleeping on an actual bed for the first time in months do that to you, it's understandable, beside despite what people think about mages or even your magical affinity, being able to cast spells do not solve all your problems, on the contrary in you experience, when magic is not used with a specific goal in mind or used to try and solve all the caster problems more often then not, increase them; deciding to push away this line of toughs, and how easily people has been somehow led to believe that magic can literally 'poof' a comfortable looking bed anywhere for you in but a moment...

What you recognize has the innkeeper voice break your line of thoughts, maybe it's for the better this time "Ah, if it isn't our newest local hero," he say without a trace of mocking in his voice "i was wondering if i had to clean up and reassign your room already lad, glad to see i won't need to"

His sincere if blunt phrase leave you more then a little stunted, you have never meet an innkeeper that cared about his, or sometimes her, guests in a genuine fashion, well beside that they could pay the rent

"if I can advise thee lad, the next time you team up with someone for whatever it is, make sure they realize the risk of blabbering about going against the cultist so openly, while you'll soon find that most people here have no like for the like of them, there is always bound to be someone that...think differently on the matter"

What? But...oh that stupid stupid dragon! What the heck she was thinking?! If the cultist get to know of our involvement they will...react..accordingly; you sbuff in anger, she want them to come out in the open, or at least their affiliate, so she can track them down

I look at the innkeeper, feigning sheepishness "Thanks for the warning," my tone then become harder, far more sincere "I'll make sure it won't happen again"

The innkeeper nod as i walk up the stairs and quickly reach my designated room, and the first thing you do once inside is looking for your 'tools', among them lie a small scroll of concentration, a decently common piece of paper with a few malleable rune meant to help the user focus on their tasks, it's also a good stress reliever to a point, as the runes always help you visualizing exactly what you want to see, shifting and twisting in your mind eye as the ink seemingly stretch effortlessly to help you concentrate channeling your energy a little easier; normally you won't need such simple artifact to achieve any manner of the minimum conscious focus required for a low level conjuration spell, but this particular design can prove very difficult to keep focused on, especially if you want to make a decent ward worth the paper is incised upon against the cultist magic, in particular the perverted mind/body altering abomination they have the gall to call runes

Just as you originally thought, dragons are proving themselves quite the nuisance for you, just as petty and proud as the common people would believe and maybe, as annoying. Your hands move expertly on the scroll as the incision finally begin to make sense magic wise, even in it's incomplete status the rune already began to absorb and redirect loose energies present in this room, the flow slowly taking shape and with it the common feeling every protection rune you have ever made, of being somewhat painlessly run through by a strain of energy as the 'magic' begin to take notice of your request

Many possible scenarios about the cultist and their possible connection in this city are attempting to emerge from the apparently calm surface that are your thoughts, such distraction can prove disastrous when focusing magic as you are doing, but thankfully the scroll of concentration already prepared beforehand manage to help you cull away all distractions, you know that you will have to deal with these thoughts later, but it's admittedly strangely refreshing being able to easily push away such distraction for the moment

Actively focusing again on your work manage to take away any stray thoughts or images not regarding your current task. The intricate design is nearly complete in record time after nearly yourself in your talent, but just as you move your hand to put the finishing touch on the ward, a stray image of Kara forcefully attempting to mate with you manage to slip in your consciousness, years of practice plus the concentration scroll permit you to easily swat off the distraction as if it was a mere fly, but the part of your brain wanting you to take notice of such possibility already succeeded in forcing you to at least consider such an event. Personally you don't think Kara will actually try to force herself on you, but you have little doubts she will try any and all the trick she know to make you at least consider the idea, a task she apparently already managed to partially achieve

For a moment or two you hesitate to complete the ward, in your experience this design will be more then enough to protect you from the cultist twisted magic, but what about Kara, what about dragons in general? Surely they seems much more civil then you would have expected, but then again, having never met one in person and having heard only voices about their abilities or aspects, can you really say that your expectations where wrong? Most of the most common speculations you and, probably most human have ever made on dragons, are coming directly or indirectly, from dragon slayers or the rare merchant that manage to strike a deal with them, and usually the merchant is quite reluctant to speak about his/her experience on the matter, you suspect that part of the deal does involve a measure of secrecy about their dealings, both for the material or service provided and, the customer details

In fact outside this curious valley and surrounding territories, this is the only place you found where dragons and sometimes, other magical creature are not attacked on sight; not always for justified reasons, but nonetheless dragons usually managed to give a mostly bad impression on pretty much anything capable of logical reasoning with both their attitude and their sometimes far too 'direct' approach to problems, often involving things humans and many know magical creatures alike find unacceptable at least, so the distrust if not the hate, are at least understandable

You half shake you head for a moment as to chase away all and any other possible distractions, instead you decide to be practical and fair, going with the little informations you manage to acquire till now, and what your instinct tell you

A quick mental review of all the interaction you had with dragons so far, indicate that at least part of the rumors about dragons are true, and that Kara has her own agenda to fulfill, and that unfortunately it involves you among the other things

Other images of possible future events are trying to surface, but you willfully push them down, they are of no consequences anyway, you already decided

Appealing to all your skill and knowledge of wards, you manage to slowly and carefully modify the rune, it's no easy task and in most cases you would have to start all over again, but being this particular design being somewhat flexible, and that the ward you have in mind can work even based on a generic energy pattern, you manage to create a rune that should work not only against the perverted cultist magic, but also against any mental or physical trick Kara or any other dragon may have in store for you; you nearly sigh as you remind yourself that this is not a race specific ward, as such it won't be affective against a direct physical attack nor it will weaken a dragon just by being close to it, but it will protect you against what you think may be used against you in a close possible future, and that will be enough

Having finally completed your task after hours of tedious, methodical work you can finally relax, letting the typical feeling of easiness coming when concluding any kind of beneficial magical ritual seep in your brain, a way to release all the stress it take on the will by using magic you wager, and quickly decide that your next stop will be the smith, where you will be able to choose both the metal and the shape more adequate for your rune, maybe if the local smith is skilled and knowledgeable enough you may even find a material that can increase the effectiveness of wards or protection magic in general, after all, it's a while since you used to have a protection amulet in direct contact with your skin, hopefully the trace of the ward will be subtle enough to pass unobserved, to Kara at least

1413211.content:
The Father of Death
Alignment-Death 0
The rickety covered wagon I’d hitched a ride on was trundling through the countryside on its way to the City of Kronos where I planned on losing myself in its vast crowds. I was not from the city but I’d heard the rumors of how the city welcomed nearly all sentient life within its walls…in the past I would have called it a perfect feeding ground but now it was just a place to hide from the All Father and his minions. I am the Father of Death though I’ve abandoned my cult and its foolish members who followed orders like dogs.
“So where are you from?” the farmer asked attempting to make small talk.
I sat there ignoring the man as I thought him of little value both in body and soul but the just kept talking in an attempt to pull me into a conversation.
“Will you just shut up,” I hissed, “I’m not here to bandy words with a fool.”
“Well I’m just trying to have a conversation,” the farmer groused, “You don’t need to be so rude.”
I snorted an pulled my hood further up my head to hide my facial tattoos from the man as they signified that I was from the Cult of Death and I wasn’t about to go broadcasting it around the world that I was a public enemy worth probably ten times my weight in gold. I hated dealing with the common folk as in my opinion they talked way too much, they were always touching one another, and no matter what you did they always became angry with you…to say the least I’m not a people person…after all I’ve been stuck as a twenty three year old man for more than a thousand years…one of the many benefits of becoming a Father in one of the cults was that you didn’t age anymore but the downside was that unless I died I would always be the Father of Death even though I abandoned the cult.
“That’s an interesting weapon you’ve got there,” the farmer commented still trying to start a conversation, “Where’d you get it.”
I adjusted my weapon which was about eight feet long with a crescent on top with the tips pointed downwards and a foot long spear head on top of it, the crescent blade was about four feet long, and on the other end of the weapon was a small ten sided cube on the bottom to act as a club if need be.
“I’ve always had it,” I sighed fed up with this farmer; “Now I’ve a question for you…will you die if you don’t have anyone talk to?”
This shut the farmer up allowing me to focus on what I was going to do when we finally reached if the farmer kept irritating my I might eat his soul though it would probably be nothing but farming knowledge I would gain from it. We were supposed to meet up with a merchant caravan somewhere down the road but something was wrong as we should have met other caravans meeting up with us at this point…
“My great giddy aunt,” the farmer whispered utter fear in his voice, “What the hell happened here.”
I climbed out of the wagon and proceed to walk around it and saw what had caused the farmers distress. The clearing where we were supposed to meet the merchants was now a charred mass of bodies and ruined wagons. Someone or something had attacked them and stolen their goods revealing that it at least had some sentience and that it or they could be dangerous.
“Wait here,” I warned the farmer the excitement of the hunt dripping from my voice, “I will clear the area of all hostiles.”
He nodded but the real reason was that I simply hungered for souls right now and I couldn’t harvest the farmer as he was too important at the moment. I had my weapon raised in front of me the scythe blades horizontal and the spear tip pointing straight ahead of me. I would give no quarter in this battle and devour any who dare opposed me. I stepped into the wastes hearing my steel boots crunch both charred wood and bone not caring whether it had once been a living being as all who could not save themselves were dead wait and meant to be devoured by those stronger than them…it was natures law. I could hear the sound of the enemy approaching drawn to my presence like moths to a flame and the results of this foolish action would end just the same. As they appeared at the opposite edge of the clearing I noted that they were all humans and soon they would be nothing more than a snack. As they closed in on me I saw that they were nothing more than common bandits.
“Surrender all yer valuables or we’ll stick ya,” the lead bandit snarled.
“You shall regret attacking me mortal,” I hissed, my golden eyes glowing from under my hood, “But don’t worry you won’t have long to regret your descion.”
I charged at them cleaving through the first three in my first swing shocking their companions as their bodies disappeared only to reform into a single glowing wisp but I didn’t give them time to even think as I turned towards the remain six with a bloodthirsty smile on my face and again I charged ripping through four of them as the last two turned to flee from me. I jumped skyward and while in midair I flipped positioning myself between them and their targeted escape route.
“Oh don’t tell me you’re leaving so soon,” I taunted, “I was hoping you’d stay for lunch.”
“Please don’t kill us,” one of the bandits whined falling to his knees, “Please show mercy!”
“…Mercy…ha…haha…hahahahahaha!” I burst out laughing, “You killed all these people and you expect mercy…Mercy has no place in this world.”
I ripped through both of them with my weapon and as they turned into wisps I smiled at this…though they wouldn’t provide much strength or knowledge to me but I hungered to devour souls…any soul. I gazed as the three wisps moved towards each other until they merged into a single blue wisp whose center was the size of an apple. I reached out my clawed hand to take it and when I did I devoured it in a single gulp. I gained little knowledge or skills of note but the boost it gave to my energy and knowledge of my surroundings was well worth the troubles. I walked back to the farmer who was still sitting in the wagon and before he could ask any more questions I motioned him forward while climbing back into the wagon. The steady rumble of the wagon continuing on it way as storm clouds began to roll in the sound of distant thunder accompanying them and soon after this the rain began pouring drenching the poor farmer but thankfully we were approaching the gates to the city of Kronos. We were stopped by the gate guard but with a wave of my hand I’d manipulated their minds to let me through. As the wagon trundled through the gate I crawled out silently and let it continue on without me as I had not promised the farmer anything so I saw no reason to stay. I walked through the streets with my weapon on my back looking for a place to stay the night while attempting to control my hunger for souls. I’d found an inn called the Drunken Elf which I found slightly funny as one of the last things you’d ever see was a drunken elf but the urge to hunt and feast was great but that would be one of the greatest mistakes I’ve ever made in my life. Staying at the inn would allow me to search for a job or a good fight to lessen my thirst for the hunt…I need to decide what to do now.

I entered the inn to find it divided into two different areas, a well light area that was spacious and beautifully decorated and the other was just as well decorated but darker…the darker area is where I went. I sat a table in the corner as a group of barbaric warriors stood shouting and cheering drunkenly and making a complete spectacle of themselves. As I stood there shaking my head a human barmaid approached me and to say she was gorgeous was an understatement but that wouldn’t affect me as I’ve been emotionally dead for the last five hundred years.
“I don’t think I’ve seen you around here before,” She gushed, “You must be new here…what can I get you.”
“Get me a glass of water and I’d like to rent a room for the night,” I sighed already feeling annoyed.
“Okay…can I get you anything else?” She inquired smiling.
“No,” I answered dryly.
“Are you sure?” she continued to bother me.
“Yes I’m sure,” I hissed losing my cool, “Now very well get me what I asked for or don’t and leave me the hell alone!”
This must have shocked her because she ran off tears running down her face…and I couldn’t have cared less if I tried. I was tired, hungry, and soaked from the storm raging outside…I hated this time of year in this land because it was nearly always raining. I heard the floorboards behind me creak causing me to turn around and come face to face with a blue dragoness in her humanoid form wearing scarred black leather armor…she was glaring at me.
“You should be more polite to people,” she hissed at me, “or bad things you can’t even imagine will happen to you.”
“Humor me,” I hissed back, “because I can imagine a lot of horrible things.”
“I’ll tear you apart for starters,” she threatened, “I won’t let you insult my friends.”
“I’m sorry but I’ve seen much scarier creatures than you,” I yawned causing her to lunge at me but I grabbed her wrist and twisting it and causing it to dislocate, “I see an overgrown lizard needs to be taught a lesson.”
I whipped her through a window shattering it and drawing the attention of everyone else.
“Oh my god,” the barmaid from before shrieked, “He’s overpowered Nariza!”
“I’ll pay for the damages,” I hissed at the owner as I jumped out the broken into the raining soaked street.
The dragoness was on her hands and knees’ gasping for air as a shard of glass was emerging from her side. She pulled the shard from her body brutally the blood pooling on the street before the wound closed up. She rose to her feet glaring at me with bloodlust in her eyes.
“I was looking for a good fight,” I laughed a sadistic gleam in my eyes, “and it looks like I’ve found one.”
“What do you mean?” she hissed at me.
“I mean that I’ve come here to prove I’m the strongest being in the world,” I hissed an insane grin on my face, “I mean to free myself from the chains that hold me back.”
With those words I lunged at her my weapon out stretched to run her through but she evaded to the left seeking to rake her claws across my hooded face but I blocked with one of my gauntleted fists and struck again slicing her back open as she was too slow to evade the attack fully but still dodged the brunt of the attack. She launched an arrow made of magic at me but I simply knocked it out of the air but that was a mistake as she had closed the distance and reached towards my face her claws hooking under my hood as she lunged and ripping it clean off of the robes revealing my facial tattoos.
“You’re a damned cultist,” She hissed jumping back.
“No I’m not a cultist,” I sighed feeling older than I’ve ever felt, “I’m a man whose seeking freedom…is that so wrong?”
She was silent as she stood there just staring at me as if what I said was impossible but she didn’t have long to contemplate what I said as we were interrupted.
“How sweet,” a sultry female voice behind us snickered, “I’d thought they were kidding when they said you were attempting to leave the cult.”
“Mira,” I snarled turning to see a scantily clad voluptuous woman with an eye tattoo on her forehead, “I wouldn’t have thought they’d send the head priestess of Lust to apprehend me…after all I’ve not expressed interest in anyone.”
“I’ve not been sent to collect you,” She sighed sadly, “I’ve been sent to collect the dragoness…though I wouldn’t mind collecting you.”
“I won’t let you take her,” I laughed, “I’ve sought an opponent worth fighting and now that I’ve found one I won’t let you take her…and besides it damages the All Father’s plan.”
With that I charged the priestess and lashed out with a brutal series of slashes which she easily dodged and counterattacked with a chain whip she had been hiding…I don’t know where so don’t ask…I barely dodged the main attack but she had somehow managed to wrap the weapon around my leg and proceeded to bash me into walls and the force of the blow jarred me causing me to lose focus. As I fell to the ground I went limp as I lost the will to continue on with the fight her magicks weakening me severely.
“Awww is my new plaything broken already,” she whined, “Oh well…at least I’ll have the dragoness to play with.”
“What do you want with me?” Nariza snarled.
“You hold the key to a thousand year old secret,” Mira answered calmly approaching her while working her magic causing the dragoness’s slit to moisten, “and I’m to claim it from you by any means necessary.”
“What are you doing?” the dragoness moaned as Mira approached her and began stroking her slit.
“I’m going to interrogate you,” Mira whispered seductively inserting a finger into the dragoness slit causing her to moan, “Now tell me what I want to know and I’ll make you feel so good.”
“Ah…ah…n-no…I won’t…h-h-help you!” Nariza yelled trying to resist the woman, “I won’t divulge his secret…he-ah-trusted me…and I won’t-ah-betray that trust.”
“Are you so sure?” Mira asked smiling inserting more fingers causing Nariza to roar in orgasm.
I was now regaining my strength quickly as non-cultist magic cast on cultists by other cultists was severely weakened while cultist magic cast on cultist by cultist will be completely nullified as cultists are immune to cultist magicks and abilities. I was back on my feet and now I was angry…I would not be toyed with…and besides I’ve always hated the sisters of the lust cult due to their actions…and I would not let such a worthy opponent fall to such cheap tactics. I charged at Mira knocking her out of the way and launching her into the side of a building.
“You’re stronger than I suspected,” Mira snarled peeling herself off the wall.
“Are you alright?” I asked the dragoness who was laying on the ground in a compromising position the lower part of her leather armor flipped up revealing her slit…I was starting to blush so I turned away.
“What happened?” she asked sitting up, “I can’t remember what happened.”
“You were under the influence of this whore,” I snarled raising my weapon, “but don’t feel bad as this whore can warp even the strongest minds to do her bidding.”
“Wait she-,” Nariza shouted covering herself in a panic, “I’ll kill her for defiling me!”
I was already moving to attack her but she dodged right and to dodge left avoiding her counter attack as well as leaving her open to mine. I lashed out with my spear completely severing her right arm which was holding the whip.

141321111.content:
-Chamber of Requiems-
Six figures sat in seven thrones six of them hid by shadows the sixth had her throne exposed to a light from above but the seventh was empty.
“So Mira you failed in a simple task to capture a dragoness,” one of the figures snickered his voice a deep male one.
“Are you jealous Avarice,” another male voice taunted, “That she had been picked for this mission and not you?”
“Shut your mouth Gluttony,” Avarice hissed, “She should have been able to easily take care of the dragoness.”
“But Death stopped her,” a high pitched female voice shrieked, “He’s the strongest of us…how could she hope to defeat him.”
“Why don’t you fall silent Despair!” another male voice filled with malice roared, “Your voice gives me a headache!”
“But Hatred,” Despair whined, “Death is so strong…what chance do we have!?”
“He is not invincible,” a voice hissed with a sound that brought images of decay to mind, “He can be felled as any other creature can…he is not immortal.”
“He’s lived for over a thousand years,” Mira snarled, “He is the first of us…We can’t just kill him Pestilence”
“Don’t let your feelings for him cloud your mind,” Avarice hissed, “You are Lust…you’ve no place for a weak emotion such as Love.”
Arguments broke out among the six cult leaders until a deep voice rumbled the very foundations of the Chamber.
“This is no time to argue my children,” the voice thundered
“All-Father,” all the others whispered in reverence.
“Mira has failed…but the unexpected appearance of Death is to blame,” the voice sounded, “but it is not surprising…given his past.”
“You mean his previous life before he was given his gifts?” Pestilence hissed.
“Yes…he will be drawn to artifacts of that time as they resonate with his soul,” The All-Father thundered, “The increase in his power is an unforeseen problem but I fear it may just be the beginning.”
“What do you mean?” Despair whined.
“The All-Father means that Death was a great leader even before the All-Father found him,” Mina the head cultist of Lust snarled, “He will be able to find many new followers within that accursed city…he may even attempt to open the final lock for himself.”
“Which is why he must be stopped…no matter what,” The All-Father hissed, “Razim…Stand…You are to eliminate him.”
“As you wish,” Razim the Head cultist of Hatred whispered getting to his feet.
Razim was olive skinned and bald except for a ponytail that was blood red in color. He wore crimson leather armor and on his hip he had a morning star mace…he was the third strongest out of all of them. The rest of the time was spent talking about how they should end death but Razim (Hatred) did not care what they wanted so he got up and left. Mira had left earlier and she was found by Razim gazing out on the setting sun…she’d never though Death had been a flunky who could be bent to another’s will…she was the second oldest on the council and one of the strongest but was stronger than all of them…she would tell no one this but she did have feelings for Death she just didn’t know what they meant…or what she would do if he died…but one thing that made him dangerous was his ability to steal souls…the souls he stole would grant him their bearers strengths and knowledge…but it did have its limits…if he devoured too many souls he would steadily lose himself to the madness of the memories of all he devoured…and he would cease to be himself.
-The next day-
I woke in a soft bed with warm though well-worn blankets and sheets. I looked to my right to see two windows with sunlight shining through them but as I looked to my left I nearly shouted in shock. I saw that the blue dragoness from last night was sleeping in a chair next to my bed looking quite serene after last night’s events. I attempted to get up without waking her but I failed horribly.
“Where do you think you’re going?” she inquired smiling.
“Why are you here…and where is here?” I questioned right back.
“You’re at the inn,” she answered smiling, “and as to the why…you saved my life so I owe you a debt…and I will see it repaid.”
“Fine,” I sighed not sure what was going on.
“I have some suggestions for what you should do,” she offered, “you said you were looking for a good fight well you could take a shot at the stadium or you could try and complete some jobs on the job board.”
Both options seemed pretty self-explanatory. So what should I do?

1413211111.content:
Reaper-+2
I had woken up this morning to find the dragoness I’d been fighting the night before tending to my wounds due to her thinking I saved her life the previous night from the head priestess from the Cult of Lust. We were now walking down the street where people were staring in awe at the damage our battle last night caused. We approached the stadium which was a giant stone structure that reminded me of the coliseums of old where I would fight to spread the words of the All-Father on the edge of my blade.
“So explain to me the rules of this…completion,” I told her my armor clinking softly.
I was wearing my combat armor which was purple feudal knight’s armor with a purple steel sallet helm hiding the upper part of my face.
“Well you’re seeking to enter the highest level of the tournament which means you’ll have greater rewards such as money, items, and…other things.” She stated shyly.
“What other things?” I asked curiously.
“Well the winner gets to…have their way with the loser,” She sighed blushing slightly.
“Doesn’t matter I don’t plan on losing,” I snarled, “but what about killings…can people die?”
“Yes…but there is magic that tries to reduce this,” she answered, “It won’t stop it if the attack is potent enough to breach the wards but otherwise no one should die outright.”
“Yippee,” I laughed, “I’m guessing though that there’s still pain though.”
“Yes,” she told me.
We continued bantering as we walked through the archway into the coliseum. I looked around to see multiple species wandering around the area not all of them the usual one you’d see. There were goblins, orcs, trolls, humans, griffons, dragons, dwarves, elves, and other creatures just wandering around.
“I’ll go sign you up…,” Nariza told me as she took off towards the stone desk.
I began wandering around and eventually found myself on the upper level of the stadium gazing out on a the field I noticed that the stands only extended about ¾’s around while the point I was at was just a sheer drop allowing me an unobstructed view of the current battle between a troll and five humans…the humans weren’t doing well. The troll was using its superior size and strength to smash the humans who’s weapons and spells simply bounced off its thick hid.
“The humans don’t stand a chance,” I hissed as I heard Nariza approach me from behind.
“I can concur,” she sighed, “That’s Thorgim…he’s won two hundred battles straight without one loss.”
“I wouldn’t mind destroying that record,” I smirked, “Oh and you may want to move back.”
“Why-,” she began before she was cut off by an explosion ripping the area in front of us clean off and leaving a gaping hole…the troll had won and one of the humans lay in a crumpled heap before me.
“Is there any who will challenge me!?” the troll named Thorgim roared, “or are you all cowards.”
“What’s the reward for his defeat?” I inquired grinning.
“Fifty thousand gold,” she answered looking worried, “You’re not thinking about fighting him.”
“He needs to be put in his place,” I laughed stepping towards the edge, “and I could use a workout before the main event.”
I drew my weapon and jumped through the hole and plummeted to the ground drawing gasps from the crowd and the attention of the troll. I hit the ground throwing up a cloud of dust but when it dispersed I was standing with my weapon resting on my shoulder.
“So you wish to fight me little human,” the troll snarled, “where’s the rest of your team!”
“I don’t need a team to eliminate you,” I hissed lifting my weapon so the tip pointed straight at the troll. “You shall learn your place human!” the troll roared charging me with a frenzied rush.
I simply sidestepped the attack and countered with a simple thrust of my weapon which pierced the troll’s skin as if it was paper. As blood oozed from the wound the troll whirled around and swung wildly but I easily evaded that attack. I thrust at the troll with my weapon again and was rewarded by the scream of pain from my opponent. I struck again piercing its leg and bringing it easily to a knee.
“Surrender!” I snarled.
“Never will I surrender to a puny human,” Thorgim roared getting to his feet and swinging at me with his club.
I dodged his inaccurate attack, I jumped over him flipping, while I was in the air, I struck with a powerful swing…impaling him on a curved blade of my weapon. I pulled him over me with a massive amount of strength and slammed him into the ground causing the ground under us to shatter. My weapon remained impaled in the troll’s unmoving body. I walked over and ripped my weapon from my opponent not caring about the extra damage I did…the blood flowed freely from his wounds showing he was still alive but for how long I did not know as his injuries were grave. The crowd was silent in their utter disbelief of how easily I defeated Thorgim who had never come close to defeat in his two hundred matches. Slowly but with the force of a coming tidal wave the crowd broke into cheers and shouts…I just stood there one hand on my neck as I cracked it. I didn’t care about their pathetic cheers…all I wanted was a good fight and this one had been a great disappointment to me. I strode through the doors leading out of the arena…most of the other fighters parted ways before me in both fear and awe but one didn’t…he wore a white set of robes and gripped in his hands were a set of hand-axes that looked old but well cared for. I paid him no attention but I made a mental note to look into this strange man. I reentered the atrium to find Nariza standing there waiting for me. I approached her to find that she was standing there smiling at me the excitement evident in her eyes.
“I haven’t seen a battle handled like that in a thousand years,” She cheered happily, “I’ve only seen a fighter like you once before.”
“I’m personally dissatisfied with that battle,” I sighed sadly, “I was expecting more from such a hyped opponent.”
I heard footsteps approaching us so I turned to see someone in a set of extravagant robes with a piece of paper clutched in his hand.
“You are Master Locke correct?” he asked not waiting for an answer, “This is your battle ticket and the card registering your winnings with the local bank.”
He quickly shoved the objects into my hands and almost sprinted away. I turned towards Nariza to ask her what was the man’s problem but she was already explaining.
“He’s afraid of you,” she told me, “You brutalized one of the strongest fighters here without a single scratch.”
“Hmph,” I snorted, “where is my money?”
“It was deposited into a bank account for you,” she answered, “I took the liberty of opening one for you.”
“Thank you,” I told her honestly, “I wouldn’t have thought of that.”
“It’s what I’m here for,” she laughed, “We should head back to the Inn so we can rest up for tomorrow.”
“I agree,” I told her as we turned towards the doors and walked out neither of us realizing that there was a pair of eyes on us.
-Perspective Switch Mira-
I stood there watching them walk away and I felt jealousy well within me. How can he even stand her…she wasn’t as beautiful as me…nor was she as skilled a fighter…there had to be something else driving him to stand with her.
“Pining for an unrequited love,” Razim taunted from behind me.
“Shut up,” I hissed at him.
“I’m going to go do our job,” he snarled, “After all we were sent here to kill him.”
I panicked…I couldn’t let him die…he just had to come back to the All-Father’s side…I thought quickly and the idea hit me.
“He’s extremely powerful,” I told Razim, “We should hire some mercenaries to weaken him first.”
“I guess that makes sense,” Razim scowled storming off.
He would survive for now…I knew that he had to come back to us…or the All-Father would kill him…I couldn’t let that happen…ever.
-Dorian’s Perspective-
I had arrived at the inn with Nariza right behind me…except this time we had separate rooms…I walked up to the stairs where my room was located and as I approached my door I turned towards Nariza.
“Good night,” I told her as I stepped through my door.
For some reason I felt extremely comfortable around her…and when I talked to her what she said was so familiar to me it was like déjà vu…though I know I’ve never met her…I was sure of that. I lay down on my bed and thought about what I should do tomorrow…I could enter a tournament or go check the job board…what to do?

141321111112.content:
Reaper-+2
I awoke early the next morning and so I decided to head down and take my now customary table…I’d made quite an impression on these people. As I sat at my table the barmaid from my first night here came walking towards me cautiously…but that quickly faded as she returned to her normally chirpy self.
“So what are you going to have to drink?” she inquired smiling.
“A glass of water,” I yawned.
“Do you only order water?” she sighed.
“None of your damn business,” I hissed sourly, “but tell me where is Nariza?”
“She went to find you two a job,” She told me, “She told me to tell you she’d be back in an hour.”
“Fine,” I sighed, “If she’s not going to be back in a while I’d like some scrambled eggs and toast for breakfast.”
“Oh and how are you going to be paying for this then?” she inquired angrily.
“Put it on my tab,” I yawned.
“What tab,” she hissed, “You need money to open a tab!”
“I’ve money from my victory against Thorgim,” I hissed agitated, “So go and get me my food…or leave me to my thoughts.”
She stormed off as I just sat there sipping my water awaiting Nariza or my food whichever came first. I was rethinking what I’d done in the last thousand years…it’s quite difficult to organize so many memories…and not all of them are mine. Whenever I devoured another’s soul I also gained their memories but the ability had a down side…if I devoured too many I would lose myself forever to madness. I would never let that happen no matter how much chaos and death I caused I swore I would never succumb to madness. I was sitting at the table lost in thought as the barmaid brought me my breakfast and quickly stormed off. I ravenously began devouring my food…almost as if I hadn’t eaten in days…I was pretty sure I hadn’t eaten in days with what was going on. Within minutes I had wolfed down and sat there with a toothpick in my mouth savoring the feeling of a having just eaten a nice hot meal. I stood up and walked to the bar area where I told the bartender to tell Nariza that I was going to the coliseum. I walked out into the street my armor glistening in the sunlight and as I walked down it I drew stares and whispers from the people doing their shopping or just loitering.
“This city is utterly disorganized,” I muttered under my breath.
I had seen many other cities in my long life and most of them had market days once a week for people to purchase non-essential items…but this city seemed to have stalls set up haphazardly. I continued down the street and to my surprise the people parted in…fear…they were afraid of me…I could see it in their movements and how they wouldn’t make eye content with me. I felt a small smile creep across my face…in the words of a famous scholar it was better to be feared than to be loved. I was approaching the coliseum when I saw something strange…two dragons walking into it in their natural forms…and that intrigued me. I followed them into the coliseum and saw that they were arguing about something…I approached as close as I dared…I may have been powerful but I wasn’t stupid enough to piss off two dragons arrogant enough to strut through the city in their natural forms…at this range I heard only bits of their conversation…the pieces I heard had to do with ingredients of some sort, something about a lover, a need for money, and about entering the battles. I followed them to the upper level which was a room with several people who seemed to be all novice fighters…I walked towards the edge so I could see who was fighting but also eavesdrop on the dragon’s conversation. The fight was between a blue dragoness and eight griffons that were using their superior numbers extremely poorly…they were presenting a unified front directly in front of her…and they were being quickly picked off for their stupidity. I was still picking up bits and pieces of the dragon’s conversations which allowed me to learn that they were attempting to enter the battles…I shifted my attention back to the battle to see the four remaining griffons now working in tangent to surround the dragoness and being to attack her from all sides.
“Finally they show some strategy,” I hissed under my breath already having picked apart their formation in my head...I was a terror on the battlefield.
The dragoness now made the mistake to try and fly which removed her from her only safe zone…the ground itself…the griffons knew this and flipped her on her back greatly diminishing her threat…and to my utter disgust the began raping her…I think…I wasn’t sure if it was non-consensual. I heard the sound of padded feet behind me but I didn’t bother turning…I already knew who it was.
“I didn’t think you were into this sort of thing,” Nariza teased.
“I’m not,” I answered blushing as the lead griffon penetrated the dragoness’s slit while another forced his way into her mouth, “Why the hell is she allowing this?”
“Who knows?” Nariza sighed with a sad look in her eyes, “Some just like the violation, some don’t have the strength left to fight, and others are just too stupid to figure out a simple way to get out.”
“Does she not fear being impregnated?” I questioned confused and disgusted as the two griffons climaxed into her…then the two who had not had their fun and went at it with her, “This is just disgraceful.”
“To what have this happen to a person?” Nariza the anger apparent in her voice.
“No…it is disgraceful that she does not fight back…that she does not resist,” I snarled just as angry, “It’s disgraceful that she doesn’t use the abilities given to her to fight them off…or at least burn them in…sensitive places.”
The griffons were now leaving their fun over and having won the battle they just walked away arrogant grins all over their faces…and I felt the rage boiling up within me…I stormed over to official now free from the presence of the two other dragons but he was sorting papers and did not notice me…so I struck the desk he was sitting behind causing him to jump.
“Yes can I help you?” He inquired smiling slightly.
“Yes when would the fighters from the battle just now be ready to fight again?” I asked him anger burning in my eyes.
“By tomorrow but neither group would even think of fighting against you,” He told me, “Your rank is too low.”
“I’m willing to wager 50,000 gold on the battle,” I snarled, “and if even one of them beats me the money is theirs.”
“I could probably convince them to fight you,” the man said his smile broadening, “Do you have a preference of who you fight.”
“I want to fight the griffons,” I snarled wishing to put them in their place.
“Okay so one griffon,” The man said.
“No I want all eight griffons,” I snarled turning and walking away.
Nariza was following me closely but did not say anything until we exited the coliseum which is when she turned to me.
“I’ve information on a job for us,” She said smiling, “It’s not worth a lot but it should win you some points with a very important person.”
“What’s the mission?” I inquired my mood soured by what I just heard.
“Well there’s a black chest that the employer is wants reacquired from a group of five trolls that stole it,” She answered me, “and then there’s a bonus if we can figure out why they stole it and kill all five trolls.”
“Sounds easy enough,” I chuckled looking skyward, “What’s the catch.”
“It’s a free contract,” She sighed, “Which means will be competing with other’s to try and acquire the chest.”
“Goody,” I chuckled to myself, “Let’s get going.”
We set out for the area of the objective but were quite confident that we could easily acquire what the employer sought…

when we arrived at the target location we found that it was a heavily wood area. As we moved through the underbrush I noticed that the area around me was already trampled by the footfalls of two others if I was any judge.
“Looks like someone already entered the area,” I warned her with a grin.
“Are you sure?” she asked.
“Yes,” I told her motioning up the trees, “We climb now.”
I shot up the tree in a blink and Nariza was quickly following me up the tree. We quickly but silently moved from branch to branch not drawing any attention…not even from the creatures who lived in the forest. We were approaching a cave set in the cliff face when I saw a man and a black dragoness in her humanoid form arguing about something…and I knew near instantly that they’re also after the bounty due to their arguing about how to attack the trolls…I saw only two guarding the entrance. I motioned to Nariza to attack…she nodded and we both leapt down from the trees with me swinging my weapon with such force that I cut clean through the first troll…I didn’t even bother turning to face the second one as I knew that it would be a waste of time. I ran into the cave with Nariza right on my heals…another troll appeared in front of me only to be pierced through the chest by my weapon…its blood running freely down my armor as I ripped it from its chest. I continued on as Nariza slew the one that appeared to aid its comrade…I ran into a large cave to find the last troll standing guard over a chest but it wasn’t paying proper attention so I quickly slew it…but I was still uneasy…these weren’t some random roving band of marauders but trained mercenaries…I saw something gleaming in the dirt and blood and as I picked it up to examine it I realized that it was a medallion of rage…a medallion only given to those serving the Cult of Rage…
“Razim,” I hissed under my breath.
“I see your senses haven’t dulled over the years,” a cruel voice laughed from the shadows.
I turned to see a man in blood red leather armor, dual wielding full size war double bladed war axes, and bristling with muscle…Razim the Father of Rage.
“I hired these mercenaries in the hope that would weaken you,” Razim hissed crushing the head of the troll under his heel, “But it seems like a waste of money with how easily you dispatched them.”
“Nariza…grab the chest,” I barked at her, “Don’t bother ask questions just do it!”
I brought my weapon up in a defensive posture while Nariza rushed in and grabbed the chest…Razim ignored her completely but the apparent grin on his face confusing.
“So it’s true,” He laughed cruelly, “I guess fate is as fickle as they say.”
“What the hell are you talking about?!” I yelled confused.
“I’m not going to bother telling you,” he shouted charging at me his axes scrapping the ground and sending up sparks, “After all your about to die anyway!”
His axes collided with the my weapons handle but the force of the blow forced me back about five steps but before I could recover he was already attacking me again…I could barely keep him back…somehow I had to put myself on the offensive and that would prove difficult. His next attack came in at an odd angle that would have broken the defenses of any less experience fighter but it gave me the opening I needed to strike…and I did block his attack and lashing out with haft of my weapon…knocking him back and allowing me to begin an advance attack pattern that allowed me to inflict minor wounds to my enemy but his skill would not allow me to perform any grievous damage.
“You’re as strong as ever Death,” Razim commented, “but you should have never betrayed the All-Father.”
“Have you ever wondered why the All-Father fears me so?” I asked smiling, “It’s due to my genetic make-up.”
“I’m sorry what?” Razim asked confused.
“I forgot I’m talking to an imbecile,” I insulted attempting to draw him out, “My blood is that of the god slayer Kyoto…which means I’m capable of killing the All-Father!”
With I charged at my enemy and began attacking with pinpoint accuracy…my attacks though minor were beginning to add up…and slowly but surely Razim was losing strength.
“Mira what are you waiting for?!” Razim shouted.
I felt fear flare in my chest as I felt a metal chain wrap around my ankle and throw me into the wall cracking it…as well as injuring my back, smashing my head off of the wall, and causing me to drop my weapon. I stumbled forward the blood beginning to flow down my face but my helmet at least remained in place. I tried to maintain my footing but I clearly had a concussion so even staying conscious was difficult.
“Looks like you’ve got something on your face,” Razim taunted as Mira appeared next to him…one opponent of their caliber was dangerous enough but two of them was a death wish…good thing I am Death, “How’s it feel to be helpless.”
“Razim that is your first mistake-gasp-thinking I’m a normal person,” I gasped my breathing ragged and broken, “your second mistake was allowing me the time to gather myself”
“Shit!” Razim roared charging at me but it was too late.
“Your third mistake was underestimating my song,” I laughed as a terrible yet beautiful melody began echoing through the cave, “Witness my Aria of Souls.”
As I felt my energy skyrocket I rushed at my two assailants and utterly decimated them…but before I could deliver the finishing blow Razim opened a portal and jumped through. Leaving me alone…and as my spell faded I passed out from my wounds…
-six hours later-
I woke up within my room in the Inn but my head was bandaged and I felt extremely groggy. I began looking around when I saw Nariza and the other two from earlier…I looked over to ask Nariza something but she cut me off.
“Look before you go asking questions let me explain,” She told me.
She explained that these two had saved my life and explained that the dragoness’s name is Karathiana and the humans name is Aranos…they had found me in the cave battered and bruised and to make matters worse Karathiana knew I was a member of the Cult of Death but had agreed to not divulge it…but they had brought me here to be healed and Nariza had agreed to split the reward fifty fifty…I again lay down wondering what would happen to my fight tomorrow…Nariza had already stated I was in no condition to fight but if I backed out I would not be able to keep my money and I would be broke…only time would tell.
1413211111121.title: continue

14132111111211.content:
Reaper-2
The arrived the morning of the next day…the griffons had agreed to my challenge…the only problem was I was severely injured in my battle the other day and healing magic can only do so much. I stood up shakily and looked around…strangely the other two from the other day were standing there but Nariza was not present.
“What did Nariza promise you to save me?” I inquired picking up my weapon.
“She promised us the name of the person behind the attack and why they did it,” Karathiana hissed at me the dislike clearly evident in her voice.
“I’ll tell you but you won’t like it,” I chuckled cruelly, “The beast behind this is named Razim…the Father of the Cult of Rage…and he set all this up to kill me in a surprise attack.”
“So wait are you saying that there’s infighting among the cults?” Aranos asked glaring at me.
“No…the cults are still unified,” I told him the confusion evident on their faces, “I’ve abandoned The All-Father and the cults…to carve out my own place in history.”
“But aren’t you a Cult Father?” Karathiana asked still glaring at me.
“I was…but no more,” I told them, “At least in my eyes…but in the eyes of the cult when you become a Cult leader it’s for life.”
“How can you be a cult father you’re barely older than me,” Aranos hissed at me.
“Mind your tone boy,” I stated coldly, “Looks can be deceiving…I’m actually over a thousand years old…and I’ll continue to live forever unless slain.”
I turned and began walking out the door using my weapon to support myself but I stopped for a few seconds to offer a warning.
“You’ve made a powerful enemy by helping me,” I warned, “and you would be wise to avoid engaging any Cult Fathers or Mothers…they are far above you in power…if you wish to see what I mean then come and watch my battle today and you shall see the power of even a wounded ex-Father can far out strip you.”
I walked down the steps shocked at what I said…the arrogance of what I said. I stepped down the stair only to bump into Nariza who seemed shocked that I was up.
“What the hell are you doing up?” She snarled at me the worry evident in her eyes.
“I’m going to my battle,” I barked right back feeling a cold calm wash over me, “and you’ve no right to stop me…I don’t even know why follow me!”
I then stormed down the stair fed up with everybody attempting to stop me from achieving my freedom…why did they bother saving me if they hate me so much…why did I put up with them…especially her…I could have sacrificed her on countless occasions to save myself…yet I didn’t…why…why would I spare her after a thousand years of death…fate is fickle. I walked down the street towards the coliseum and as I walked up the stairs I saw an official come running down the stairs towards me an angry look on his face.
“You’re late!” He yelled at me.
“Go to hell,” I hissed back as I walked up the steps.
I entered the coliseum the coliseum to find it nearly deserted but the roar of the crowd was clearly heard throughout the stadium…as was the commentator.
“It looks like the challenger has refused to attend,” The commentator commented causing the crowd to boo, “I wonder what it feels like to be a coward?”
I arrived at the gate leading to the arena highly annoyed by this fools comments so I simply blasted the gate out of the way with a burst of magic.
“What was that?” The commentator shouted as I walked into the arena, “I guess he decided to show up…is he stupid though…look at the condition he’s in.”
I walked into the arena to see the eight griffons lounging about and most of them seemed to be laughing at me.
“I think we’ve wasted enough time waiting for the challenger,” The announcer shouted, “so let us begin.”
The griffons rose to their feet and the alpha approached me with a cruel smile on its face…a smile I fully intended to wipe off.
“Why don’t you surrender,” The griffon taunted, “Save yourself from the beating of a lifetime.”
“No,” I stated raising my hand, “I think I’ll end you for your idiocy.”
I launched a powerful blast of energy sending the griffon flying into the wall on the other side of the field where he fell limp…but this small act strained my concussion causing my vision to blur for a few seconds but that was all it took for three of the griffons to close the distance to me…I barely evaded the first and second ones but the third raked its claws across my chest…if it had not been for my armor that wound would have been severe. I brought up my hand and began launching bolts of electricity which struck the offending griffon and promptly eliminated it from the battle. I back pedaled as my head began throbbing again trying to put distance between myself and my enemies. The two remaining griffons that had charged forward now simply circled me but even that was a horrible descion as it allowed me to burn them with a ring of fire magic…leaving only four left but exhausting myself…and straining my wounds. The last four took to the air and remained out of my attack range…I was inaccurate with my magical attacks so I modified my fighting style to use knife fight distance or area of affect magicks rather than the long range attacks. I was attempting to figure a way to reach them because I did not have the energy to create or maintain a floating platform. I looked around the arena to see four pillars around the area…I had enough left in me to unleash my most powerful spell…Eclipse Gate…It was a spell capable of shattering foundations of the earth itself…but it would not be able to unleash its full power in this arena but it would be more than enough to bring down my opponents. I ran at the pillar my body screaming out in agony as I literally ran up the pillar…I jumped when I reached the top…and unleashed my spell. The area around me shimmered with a purplish light…and then erupted in a huge explosion sending my opponents hurtling into the ground below…I floated for a couple seconds before I plummeted into the ground with no energy left to right myself…when I hit the ground I slowly got to my feet with the crowd roaring its approval and the commentator shouting something about a come from behind upset…but something made me uneasy.
14132111111211.title: Griffons Accept challenge(darthvaapad)

141321111112111.content:
All of a suddenly an explosion ripped through the stadium from behind me and as I whipped around I saw Razim standing in the whole flanked by about a dozen red clad knights…but in the stands even more of his warriors were beginning to rise…this situation had arrived at one of its worst possibilities.
“Who the hell is this?!” the announcer shouted confused, “I don’t see any other people on the schedule for this match.”
“How annoying,” Razim sighed targeting the box where the announcer was stationed, “I think I’ll take care of that.”
Razim launched a ball of red energy at the announcer’s booth…obliterating it and everyone inside in a single heartbeat…I felt myself go cold…even when I served the All-Father I was never killed so freely…to me killing was an art form. I turned towards him the anger evident in my eyes as the people panicked and the screaming could be heard as Razim’s followers set about slaughtering all that moved.
“Why?” I inquired my voice sounding extremely hoarse, “Why do you kill…you’ve no reason to harm these people.”
“I was never like you Death,” Razim taunted as he slowly approached me, “I never deprived myself the pleasure of the kill…unlike you…and your so called code of honor.”
“To senselessly kill does no signify strength,” I coughed as I barely blocked his attack, “All it proves is you’re a mindless beast.”
He struck again and again…I was blocking his attacks but my body was in no conditions to keep this up…so soon after his onslaught began my arms gave out and he struck with such force that I was sent flying into the wall of the arena…before I could regain my footing I was impaled on the spike of one of his axes pinning me to the wall.
“Don’t you remember Death?” Razim questioned a feral grin on his face, “Don’t you remember what it felt like to lose yourself to the madness.”
“I…,” I stuttered ashamed as I knew what he said was true…I had fought as a monster…a mindless beast.
“I can see it in your eyes,” he taunted me, “You do remember…but you try and resist it rather than letting it consume you…you are weak…and now you will end.”
I felt electricity begin crackling through my body burning me and causing severe damage to my nervous system…I was losing consciousness…he threw me into one of the pillars shattering it…I lay there leaning against the rubble barely alive…my helmet laying on the ground next to me and my weapon embedded into the wall of the arena.
“End him,” Razim told one of his soldiers who was approaching me with his sword raised…when all of a suddenly three arrows sprouted from the soldier…shortly before he was cut down by a warrior wielding a halberd.
I gazed at the soldier to see he was wearing a set of black plate armor that even though it was metal didn’t make a sound as he moved…all around emerging from the shadows were warriors dressed just like him but not all of them were wielding the halberds…some were wielding repeater crossbows, Katanas, or a Scythe and Chain and they were engaging Razim’s forces…Razim whirled around only to be met by several warriors with halberds…from behind me emerged a warrior wielding a repeater crossbow…and he knelt beside me before he began to speak.
“We’ve come at last…master,” The cultist of Death responded, “What are your orders.”
“De…Def…Defend…the civ…the civilians,” I choked out coughing up blood up in the process.
“As you wish my lord,” the soldier stated, “My lord…do you think you’ll survive this battle.”
I remained silent almost sure that I was going to die…I gazed skyward to see something in the noonday sky that took my breath away…in the sky was the full moon…a huge impossibility…but as I gazed at it I felt a strange sensation rush over my body…like being pulled from a pool of water after nearly drowning…and the first breath you took after wards…the moon seemed to call to me…and empower me.
“Do you see it?” I asked the soldier, “How is this possible.”
“How…how is the moon shining?” the soldier shouted turning towards me, “My Lord!”
This shout was due to me beginning to glow with the same strength and intensity of the moon above…slowly my armor morphed to take on a draconic appearance while also turning a deep blue. I rose to my feet my body encased in a strange new armor…my strength skyrocketing to previously unattainable levels…and all of my wounds healed fully. I slowly approached Razim who had forced his assailants back…but the look of utter terror on his said it all.
“H-h-how can you stand?!” He roared his eyes beginning to bulge, “I broke you!”
“And I’ve been repaired,” I hissed back still approaching him, “and I’m about to end you like you ended all those others.”
He charged me with both of his weapons but before he could strike I had already moved and struck him with an open palm channeling energy into the strike shredding his armor in the chest area and launching him into the side of the arena…I steadily approached him ripping my weapon from the wall and leaving a gouge in it…as I approached him my footfalls echoed throughout the arena as Razim attempted to flee…He leapt up into the stands but I teleported behind and as he turned to flee not knowing I was there I grabbed him by his throat and lifted him up into the air…the fear clear in his eyes.
“Please…don’t,” He begged me, “Please don’t do this.”
“You are a raving beast,” I snarled my voice dripping with malice, “and I shall end you…now and forever.”
He screamed as my hand began glowing with the energy of the moon…the energy flowed through his body burning him…the smoke emerging from his body as it disintegrated under the power of my attack…when I let go of his throat nothing hit the ground as his body completely disappeared. The remnants of Razim’s forces quickly scattered and my forces did not move to pursue them. They instead moved to regroup around me…I turned towards the soldier who had come to my aid earlier.
“What are you doing here?” I inquired confused as to why they were present.
“We are your people…not the All-Fathers,” the soldier told me which was a good enough answer for me, “my lord we’ve a base set up within an old cathedral a couple miles outside the city…we can head there at any time.”
I turned to look around only to see Nariza, Aranos, and Karathiana standing on the other side of the arena near the top tier…I felt bad about how we parted but Nariza was strong…I knew she could take care of herself…I knew that she didn’t need me to watch over her…I would miss her…part of me wished to stay with her…but I couldn’t just abandon my men now they were here…could I.
