1413211111121111.content:
Reaper-4
I rode at the head of my soldiers with my councilor riding at my side…He was a dark elf with a purplish gray skin color with shoulder length slicked back raven black hair. He was wearing an ornate black suit and to the outside he didn’t seem to be armed but I knew that he carried two long knives hidden on his person. We were all riding horses in an attempt to reach the cathedral ahead of our pursuers.
“I hate riding these creatures,” I hissed disgusted by the horses, “their so slow and ugly.”
“My lord we can’t all be lucky enough to have a Kirin as a mount,” my councilor chuckled.
“Morvain I can’t help it,” I laughed, “Once you’ve ridden a mythical Kirin nothing else compares.”
A Kirin was a legendary creature similar to a horse except its mane and tail were completely compromised of fire. They only appeared to those that were meant to change the world and they were immortal. They symbolized peace and prosperity. We were now approaching the gates of the walls surrounding the cathedral where there were two heavily armored soldiers standing guard with halberds. As we stepped through my breath was swept away…lining the path leading to the cathedral itself was the entire Cult of Death kneeling along the path in a show of respect to me.
“Why are there so many here?” I inquired not expecting the cult, “Don’t they know I betrayed the All-Father?”
“They do know my Lord,” A male voice rasped from my left.
I turned to see a humanoid creature garbed in a torn black cloak that only extended down to about its knees…it was very similar to a poncho…and the hood completely hid its face except for a set of glowing red eyes.
“It’s good to see you again Galthim,” I chuckled hugging the creature.
“It is nice to see you as well my lord,” Galthim hissed.
“I need my lieutenants to be gathered in the meeting hall,” I ordered as we marched through the crowd, “and I want a watch set about the cathedral…none are to be let in.”
-About 10 minutes later-
I gazed around a circular room where my lieutenants had taken their places in chairs that were set up in a circle…it was very similar to the place where the Fathers and Mothers of the Cults would meet with the All-Father. There were ten people including myself sitting here.
“I would like a status report on our operations in the area,” I told them.
“Our operatives have fully ingrained themselves within the economy of Kronos, “one of my lieutenants stated rising to his feet, “It has taken them a decade but they are now a well-respected part of the community and their businesses are very important to the community.”
“Good…I would like the names of these shops on my desk within an hour,” I told the lieutenant as he sat down and as another rose to his feet.
“The trading companies we’re bankrolling have begun to funnel rare reagents and materials to us,” the lieutenant stated calmly, “They’ve also been providing steady revenue for our coffers.”
“These caravan’s ties to us must be kept secret in order to assure their continued support,” I stated as the next lieutenant stood.
“Our agents within the town guard have been funneling us information about their movements and plans,” the lieutenant told me, “but our agents have failed continuously to infiltrate the castle.”
“Ignore the castle for now,” I told the lieutenant, “It is better if we focus on putting our agents in other places around the area instead of wasting them there.”
He nodded as the next person stood up…it was my dark elf councilor…his name was Morvain Tallow.
“My lord we’ve found and repaired twenty ancient weapons of the Empire of the Moon,” Morvain explained, “we’ve equipped these weapons on our Black Riders.”
The Empire of the Moon was one of the three great empires that dominated this world for thirty thousand years…the other two were known as the Empire of the Sun and the Empire of the Earth…the Empire of the Moon was ruled by humans and used powerful magicks and advanced technology to combat their enemies…the Empire of the Sun was ruled by dragons and this to date is the only nation of dragons ever to be founded…the Empire of the Earth was ruled by a now extinct race known as Fengarli who are pretty much just elves with antlers who used the very world itself to combat their enemies. The three empires fell a thousand years ago before the might of the All-Father…the Empires of the Moon and Sun still remained in small clans and tribes and very rarely ever left their enclaves. The Empire of the Moons advance weaponry include cannons, flintlock pistols, and flintlock rifles…but they were also known for deploying several units that attempted to mimic their enemies strengths. The Geomancer was a mage that could use the very land itself to attack the enemy, while the Dragoon was a human warrior capable of huge jumps to engage airborne targets, and then there was a unit of warriors of riders who rode horses and used pistols to attack their enemies…they were like my Black riders except they only wore light armor while my Black Riders wore full heavy plate armor. These three empires all worshiped different gods except for one which they all worshiped…Evtonall the god of eternity…Evtonall was a giant golden Wyrm with four wings and a single eye…and its said it slumbers yet waiting for the day when it is called forth once more to defend the world…to make sure that these differences did not destroy the empires the god choose three warriors…one from each empire…to defend the nations…the Empire of the Moon had the Guardian of Life, the Empire of the Sun had the Guardian of Courage, and the Empire of the Earth had the Guardian of Knowledge…these three beings were given the gift of eternal life to insure that that their skills would not pass into the void…the reason I know all this is that I was alive during the fall of the three empires and I was pretty sure I was a soldier in the Empire of the Moons army…I was pretty sure I was a dragoon…It was difficult to remember due to the fact that after joining the All-Father he seals away your memoires…but no matter how much of my memories he wiped who I was at the core would not change…and at my core I desired to bring order to this chaotic world…to prevent the unnecessary death that chaos brought about…but now that I left the All-Father would my memories return…my old skills were returning…and my strength that the All-Father sealed away was returning as well. But would who I was also return…could I even live with who I was after what I did.
“My lord are you alright?” Morvain inquired.
“I’m fine…please continue,” I told them as Galthim rose to his feet.
“We’ve inserted warriors into the coliseum to bring wealth and eventually glory to our name,” Galthim stated calmly, “We’ve also dispatched recruiters to Kronos and the surrounding areas to search out candidates to join us.”
“Good,” I stated standing up, “I would like to state now that the Cult of Death is hereby disbanded…and in its place we shall form the Death Syndicate…a mercenary guild…but all of this will be a distraction from our true objective…the down fall of the All-Father…May the gods have mercy on our souls and may our hunts be successful.”
With that I turned and walked down the hall leading to my office/living quarters but before I even reached the midway point of the hallway my world began to swim before me and I braced myself up against the wall…
1413211111121111.title: Birth of The Death Syndicate

14132111111211111.content:
“So Agathor what do you think of this marriage alliance?” a male voice behind me asked.
I turned around to see two men walking along the hallway…they were not Death Syndicate members…they were ancient warriors…apparitions of the past…the person who had spoken first was a human male wearing red plate armor…the other one was one was a male Fengarli with long mint green hair and blue Lamellar armor…this must have been Agathor.
“I find it interesting,” Agathor laughed as the both walked through me as if I wasn’t there, “Your little brother marrying the Princess of the Empire of the Sun…and the Guardian of Courage.”
“I just don’t like,” the human sighed despondently, “He’s so young…and he’s getting married before me…I’m his elder brother.”
“Don’t worry I’ll take care of him,” Agathor laughed, “and if it helps you feel better they do actually love each other.”
“Look its nothing to do with their feelings for each other,” the man stated calmly, “it’s just that he’s the Guardian of Life but before that he my little brother…the kid who would skin his knee during training and start crying…”
“You’re just afraid he’s growing up to fast aren’t you Nathanial,” Agathor laughed, “But Nariza will take care of Evens…you know that they’re madly in love with each other.”
The scene before me vanished just as quickly as it began leaving me in a stunned state…Nariza was just as old as me…and she was…is the Guardian of Courage…as well as being the Empress of the Empire of the Sun…But who was this Evens…he was clearly a member of the Royal family but I killed all of them and there was no Evens. I continued on my way to my room when I felt a rush of darkness over me as a voice entered my mind.
“So did you really think you could escape me Dorian?” the malevolent voice echoed through my mind, “Did you really think I would let you go?”
“I’m not your slave anymore,” I hissed attempting to force him from my mind, “and I will never again serve your filth.”
“Do you really think they’ll take you back…you are nothing.”
“I will not bow to your will again…never again!”
With this I unleashed a powerful burst of magic forcing the All-Father from my mind and I knew that he would not attempt to possess me again…for his own safety. I stumbled into my room and sat at my desk…I began sifting through the information on my desk…the information on the newly formed syndicates previous activities and if any of my old contacts were still alive…I had shrugged off my armor and now wore a leather overcoat and knee high leather boots and steel gauntlets…as I searched the papers there was a knock on the door.
“My lord there are city guards outside the gates wishing to speak with you,” the soldier stated.
I got up and headed to the front gate where I saw a familiar face standing at the head of the guards…and the look of shock on his face his face as he recognized who I was…this look was quickly hidden away though. He was one of my oldest agents and he had apparently made it all the way to guard captain…and that was the greatest boon ever.
“You’ve no business here captain,” I stated calmly noticing Aranos and Karathiana standing among the crowd…and that meant Nariza was somewhere…but I couldn’t see her among them…and that meant she was inside the cathedral.
“We’ve come to arrest you for the destruction at the coliseum,” The captain yelled.
“You’ve no right to arrest me captain,” I yelled back enjoying this charade; “after it was just self-defense…the fool attacked me after all.”
The captain turned and began barking orders at his men and reluctantly they dispersed Karathiana shot me a dirty look as both she and Aranos turned to leave…I left the wall only to be confronted by the blue dragoness Nariza…an elegantly designed longsword clutched in her hand...etched into the blade was the sentence “May this blade cut you a path always my love” in the script of the Empire of the Sun.
“Now it all makes sense,” I chuckled, “You’ve kept me alive to kill me for the death of you lover…Empress.”
“This blade was my gift to him as was his armor…it was to make sure he always returned to me,” Nariza hissed the tears forming in her eyes, “but he still fell…you killed him!”
“That’s just it Nariza…I remember killing Nathanial and his parents…but I don’t remember any Evens,” I laughed at the absurdity of this situation, “Don’t you see Nariza…your lover might still be alive…he might even be out there looking for you right now…all I know is that I did not strike him down…but if you still wish…strike me down…I won’t stop you.”
I spread my arms wide granting her a free shot but she still just stood there…then the door to the stables blew off of its hinges and out ran a Kirin…fully plated in Oricalcum armor it was a sight to behold as it stormed in between us blocking any chance Nariza had to attack. It stood there stamping the ground and snorting angrily.
“Luvain…move,” I told the Kirin which caused it to shake its head violently, “I said move Luvain!”
As the Kirin moved I saw Nariza was gone but the sword remained…embedded into the path in front of me. I took a couple of steps forward and placed my hand on the hilt of the blade…and for some strange reason I felt tears well up in my eyes…I thought it was over the fact that I’d abandoned Nariza…but was it something more…was it over the fact that I had destroyed the love they had…I truly hoped that she found her love…
“May your path always follow the sun…Nariza,” I whispered under my breath in the language of the Empire of the Moon a few tears running down my cheeks.
“My lord!” a messenger yelled running towards me, “we’ve found one…we’ve found a servant of the All-Father!”
“Who?” I asked smiling in an attempt to hide the conflicting emotions inside me.
“A Dragon my lord,” the messenger stated, “It’s just a rumor but it’s thought that the dragon is a high level member of the Cult of Greed.”
“Excellent,” I grinned, “Ready all of the Black Riders…and make sure that they’re all ready for battle.”
I activated a spell automatically equip my armor and weapons. I mounted my Kirin Luvain and waited at the gates for my personal bodyguards The Black Riders to arrive and when they did I smiled when I saw Morvain and Galthim riding their mounts…the gates opened and we charged out the gates and as I looked over to the side of the road I saw Aranos and Karathiana standing on the side of the road…Nariza was nowhere to be seen…I hope she was alright. As I, Morvain, Galthim, and the twenty Black Riders rode down the path we entered a fog and when I emerged from it I was on foot…and I was in a stables…I looked around to see an elderly human man standing next to another human man in silver armor with a hood hiding his face.
“So Evens…how is he doing?” The older man inquired.
“The Kirin is doing fine grandfather,” Evens laughed, “but for some reason it won’t leave.”
“Well Kirin normally don’t stay in one place,” the grandfather laughed, “Kirin don’t leave if they feel a strong connection with someone…who knows maybe it bonded with you.”
“I doubt it,” Evens laughed as the Kirin emerged from the stall to nudge him in the back, “What is it-,”
I emerged from the mist with my forces in toe…wondering why these visions keep flashing through my mind…it didn’t matter…I had to keep my mind focused on my mission…after all hunting a dragon was no laughing matter…but with my Black Riders riding with me I felt safe. Black Riders wore black heavy plate armor and used a longsword and shield in melee combat but in ranged they would use their flintlock pistols and to be caught in a volley from them was an assured death. Their horses weren’t normal either. They were specially bred to have huge amounts of stamina and their eyes were solid red…and to make them even more intimidating was the fact that they for some reason had horns…this is why they’ve earned their nickname Devil Riders…but I must think about the battle to come…but one thought kept breaking through…who was this Evens?
-Perspective switch to Nariza-

141321111112111112.content:
Reaper-4
We thundered through the plains as we approached the mountains…twenty four horsemen prepared and armored for battle…as we approached the mountains creatures fled before us…as if we were an oncoming cataclysm…I grinned as I thought of this…we were here to bring down a fully grown dragon…and who knows how many others he had with him. As we broke over the hill we had been riding over we came across our target…and he wasn’t alone…two black dragons lay basking in the sunlight apparently completely unperturbed by the world around them…they both seemed to be adults but the target was far older and I could tell they were related…more than likely father and son…but I was not afraid…I came here to kill and I would kill…none cheat Death.
“I want half of you to target the youngest dragon and the other half to target the elder dragon,” I ordered as the Black Riders drew their pistols and Morvain and Galthim drew their blades, “Kill only the youngest if he’s hostile…I need information from the other one.”
I rode down the hill towards my targets but they did nothing…the younger one shifted but otherwise ignored me.
“Leave human,” The eldest one snarled at my approach not bothering to open his eyes, “before you become a light snack.”
“I’m afraid I can’t leave,” I laughed the venom practically dripping from my voice, “I’ve come here to collect a life…and I never leave without it.”
The dragon opened its eye only halfway but when it saw who it was looking at its eye shot all the way open and I could tell he was terrified as his pupil dilated in fear. He went to fly away and abandon his companion who was just waking up but I raised my hand and chains of black energy flew out of the ground and bound him as he was pulled to the ground…the roar of the other dragon was heard as I turned to see it move to lunge at me…then thunder ripped across the battlefield as my soldiers launched a volley from their pistols…normally mortal weapons wouldn’t even effect a dragon…but these weapons were designed to pierce magic and armor…the shots struck the dragon’s head piercing its skull and brain…the assailant went limp almost immediately…death came swiftly for those who attacked me…I dismounted the Kirin and slowly approached the bound dragon…I could see his eyes begging for mercy but he had nothing to give me…I slowly approached and raised a gauntleted hand which then began to glow in an ethereal bluish light...I plunged my hand into his skull and felt my hand imbed itself into my captive mind…this move was not meant to kill but to allow me access to the targets memories…I would gain information at any cost…I would kill the All-Father and free the world from its shackles…but I needed to focus now…I sifted through his memories and learned that the dragon we’d killed was his son…but he also had a daughter…I saw her and I began laughing to myself…It was Karathiana…I pushed deeper into his mind the dragon’s defenses crumbling before me…I reached the memories concerning the cult…I began sifting through the information he had when I stumbled upon something that drained the color from my face…and then I felt anger…I ripped my hand from the dragon’s mind and picked up my weapon…and removed the dragons head from its body…I mounted my Kirin and took off like the wind my guards following as closely as they could…only Galthim and Morvain could keep up.
“My lord what is wrong?” Galthim asked as his mount ran at its fullest.
“Avarice,” I yelled over the howling wind, “Avarice is leading Kronos…he is leading the city…I’ve all the shops and people loyal to him…and I plan on doing something about it…Morvain send a message to our allies…they are to march on the city immediately.”
Morvain nodded and produced a green wisp that immediately flew off towards the city…but who were these allies Dorian spoke off…
-Enclave of the Moon-
The enclave was located deep in a mist shrouded forest…the Enclave of the Moon was the largest of the Enclaves and the head enclave…what they said go went…wandering around the enclave were men and women dressed in plain hooded white robes…almost monk like in appearance…but they were anything but…they were warriors tried and true from centuries of fighting and war…and they were loyal to the Death Syndicate…even though its leader had destroyed their empire they believed in the power of redemption…and the mercy he had shown them…and they would fight to the death if he asked…a gasp rent the air as onlookers spotted a greenish wisp go flying through the air before stopping in the square above the fountain…
“It is time…time for the march on the city of Kronos…so commands the master,” the voice rasped, “Greed and corruption have taken root in the city…and it must be purged!”
The wisp disappeared as there was a flurry of activity as the Enclavists ready themselves for battle…
-The city of Kronos-
The streets were utterly silent as the lord of the city had ordered a lockdown for some reason…but moving from shadow to shadow were messengers of death spreading word to his followers that a call to arms had been issued…and his followers answered shop keepers armored in chain armor and swords, farmers with leather armor and spears, blacksmiths in plate armor and war hammers, mercenaries armed with any weapon or armor imaginable, and city guardsmen…all moving into the streets towards the capital building…in something between a mob and a trained army…people looked out their windows to hundreds if not thousands of people marching through the street girded for war…far out numbering the other military forces in and around the city…then a horn sounded from the gates and as people turned to look through the gates rode death at the head of his host…he was done with subtly and plotting…he was here to wage war against the city…and it looked like nothing could stop him.

-Dorian Locke-
I rode into the city through the open gate with my host behind me…the streets were empty except for my followers…I rode into the city hoping to reach the capital building before the fighting began as I knew that if Avarice fell then his forces would break and scatter…as we proceeded through the city I found a man blocking my path several of my city guardsmen lying dead around him…I snorted in disgust as I realized it was Aranos…the fool I didn’t have time for this…I would kill him if I had to but I didn’t want to as I thought his eyes could still be opened to the truth of the world…
“So you finally reveal your intentions,” Aranos snarled raising his sword…a foolish act of defiance.
“You cannot win this fight Aranos,” I sighed realizing that he would fight no matter what I said, “but I know that you won’t back down…it’s not in your nature.”
Aranos roared as he launched a ball of flame at me but much to both our surprise a spear appeared and batted it away…holding the spear was a Dragoon with crimson armor…Aranos stared in shock at the sight of this warrior…a legend of the past appearing and…saving their enemy…
“Lord Death leave this fool to me,” the Dragoon snarled getting into his battle stance, “My master awaits you in front of the Capital building…and good luck with your hunt.”
I nodded as my forces split to converge on the capital building from different directions…Aranos moved to pursue me but the Dragoon blocked his path…and I knew that Dragoon would fight to the death to hold that path…
I moved my cavalry rapidly towards the capital only to be blocked by another obstacle…Karathiana…and she was growling at me hatred glinting in her eyes as I attacked her home…
“I knew you were evil,” she snarled, “I knew you would come to conquer this city…you may no longer serve your precious All-Father but you’re now a raving beast set loose upon the world.”
“Our master is far from raving,” a voice sounded from an alley way as two dragons in their humanoid forms walked out of it…a black and a red…they were both wearing plate armor and held in both their hands two great swords each…the black was clearly male and I knew the red had both sexual organs…but these two were two of my greatest agents…and legends in the coliseum for having fought five hundred battles and never having lost…I could see the confusion on Karathiana’s face…how could two legends fight for this mad man…
“Master we shall hold off this whelp,” the red commented dryly as it smiled slyly, “It shall be interesting to see what she is capable of.”
“Leave this to Ingveld and I sir,” the black snarled, “This pup is about to find what it means to face true warriors.”
“As you wish,” I stated spurring my horse past Karathiana, “Ingveld…Nixtrom…stay safe.”
I again charged forth down the streets passing people who looked on in shock until we reached the capital which had been surrounded by my forces…and there standing on the landing between the two stair cases was Avarice himself trying to disperse the crowd but to no avail…and he was an older man in his mid-fifties but he still was one of the largest threats to the world as any Cult Father…and I would put him down like the monster he was. I dismounted and marched up the steps and as I gazed around I saw Dragoons, enclave musketeers, and other soldiers in the crowd…I saw nearly every race in the crowd…from dragons to trolls…all having heeded my call to arms…I turned my gaze back to Avarice to see that he had frozen in fear and had paled considerably…I smiled as I saw more of my forces enter the area along with Ingveld, Nixtrom, and the Dragoon…I could see from the lack of blood on their armor that they had allowed both Karathiana and Aranos to escape…but I returned my attention to the man in front of me who summoned his weapon…a spear with a drill lance on top instead of a blade…I readied myself for battle neither of us exchanging a word…
-Edge of the Crowd (third person)-
Karathiana and Aranos emerged from an alley together and gazed at the amassed group of people in awe…but they knew that they had to get to Death and prevent him from killing the leader of the city…they could not let him gain control of the city of Kronos…as the approached the crowd a figure appeared out of the crowd…it was the dark elf Morvain…and emerging from the shadows next to him was the wraith Galthim…Morvain had his duel long knives out while Galthim was holding a thing longsword with a blade of a strange black metal…
“You fools dare interfere with our master’s goals,” Galthim hissed angrily, “without even knowing his objectives or motives.”
“I have to agree with Galthim,” Morvain chuckled, “You are ignorant fools…allow us to educate you.”
“I’m sorry I think I’ll skip class today,” Aranos hissed.
“You’ve no choice but to attend,” Morvain laughed a mad gleam in his eyes.
“Class is in session,” Galthim growled as the battle between these four warriors began.

Avarice struck out with a feral blow hoping to catch me of guard but I easily evaded it and struck out with a kick striking him in the face and an audible crack echoed across the area as his nose broke and blood spurted from it…Avarice was dangerous…he was a coward…preferring to leave his flunkies to do the fighting…I could see the fear already spreading throughout his body just from my first attack…I struck again as he panicked…my weapon’s blade run through this chest as I lifted him up into the air…the very area around me seemed to buzz with energy…I whipped him into the air and as he spun screaming I jumped after him…my blade glowing in the fires of the setting sun…I began a complex attack pattern known as the Aria of Twilight…his body was broken but his spirit remained…I rose above him and impaled him once again on my weapon…and then we plummeted once again towards the earth with me slamming him into the ground…the life left his eyes but I knew better as I gazed upwards to see his soul attempting to flee but I would not let him be reborn…I threw my weapon through the spirit killing it and banishing it to oblivion…I’d done it…I’d freed the city…but to the people I would always be a villia-…wait…this darkness…no!...I whirled around to see a behemoth of a humanoid standing before me…He was almost fifteen feet in height and covered in black plate armor…his horned helm hid his face but shining underneath it were pure white glowing eyes…it was the All-Father himself…
“No,” I whispered backing away the fear evident in my voice, “No…why are you here.”
“You’ve interfered with my affairs for too long,” The All-Father stated…his voice filled with malevolence but still calm and loud enough for all to hear, “You’ve slain Avarice and freed this city from my grip…it is but a speck but it has proven adept ensnaring the weak…even good intentions can be turned towards evil…you should know Death…after all you sacrificed yourself so the woman you loved would be spared my wrath…what a noble soul you were…but now you will die.”
I was frozen with fear as he approached me slowly…I knew I was going to die…I couldn’t oppose the All-Father himself…he was a deity…even if he was a cult deity…I was a descendant of the god killer but I wasn’t nearly as strong as my ancestor…I gritted my teeth as he approached and put his hand around my throat and lifted me into the air…his grip constricting my air way…I was being choked and I couldn’t do anything…I was going to die here…I was
“Help me!” a voice roared through my mind…it was Nariza…she was in danger…I’d failed all my friends…my kingdom…the people I was sworn to protect…I wasn’t going to fail her…with a strength unknown to me I broke the All-Father’s grip and hand-springed away.
“Why won’t you just die,” the All-Father hissed as I picked up my weapon…the crowd looked on in fear…even Galthim, Morvain, Aranos, and Karathiana had stopped fighting.
“I’ve failed everyone I’ve ever known,” I whispered the tears forming in my eyes as I remove my helmet to reveal brown hair and the disappearance of my tattoos, “but I won’t fail her…I will fight to the end for the Empress of the Sun!”
With that I charged him a power blazing through my body as I lashed out with an attack pattern known as the Aria of the Rising Sun…but when the smoke cleared the All-Father stood there with not even a scratch on him…he charged at me and launched me over the crowd and into the side of a building which then proceeded to collapse on me…I was buried in the rubble the darkness suffocated…I struggled against the darkness but I could not break free…
“Fight on,” a wizened old voice sounded in my head, “You are my chosen…and you shall fight on.”
“What?” I asked as I felt a warm light surround me…the rubble around me flew away as if caught in an explosion.
I rose out of the rubble my armor having gone through another transformation…it had become thin but still plated my whole body except for my head…it was made from oricalcum and had a battle cape starting at my waist and going down to hang an inch from the bottoms of my feet…my eyes had taken on a golden glow as I felt power surge through me…more of my memories had awoken…I was a commander…someone important in the Empire of the Moon…and as I turned my gaze towards the All-Father and raised my hand…launching a disk of energy at the All-Father which hit him and caused him to stumble back...I was literally floating about a foot off the ground as I approached him…but was it really me controlling my body…I felt this power coursing through me augmenting my own strength…

The seven thrones still remained but this time four of them were revealed to the light…one had been shattered and lay in a ruined heap, one had part of the back slashed off, one was unoccupied, the last was occupied by a red dragon in its humanoid form…this dragon bristled with muscle and wore simple crimson colored plate armor…a snarl affixed to its face. The last three seats were still blanketed in darkness.
“So three have already fallen,” Gluttony stated lazily, “at least one has returned to the fold.”
“Fall silent you cretin,” the dragon snarled.
“I’ve to ask you,” Pestilence chuckled cruelly, “How is your new form suiting you Razim?”
“Shut your mouth Pestilence,” Razim roared, “Or I’ll tear your throat out.”
This was Razim the man that Death had slain days ago…Death had failed to destroy his soul and so it had returned to the All-Father who had taken the bodies of one of his followers and transferred Razim’s soul to it.
“So Avarice is dead, Razim defeated, and Death defected,” Despair whined, “and where the hell is Mira?”
There was much muttering to this and arguing among the four remaining councilors…but all of this stopped when the All-Father appeared in the group.
“We’ve hit a slight kink in our plans,” The All-Father snarled, “Death is beginning to remember who he was…and Mira has disappeared…add to that that Death is preparing his forces to assault our ally at the Haunted city.”
“Send me,” Razim hissed standing up, “I’ve a bone to pick with him.”
“He will not expect you to attack him so soon,” The All-Father chuckled, “Take Pestilence with you…”
-Courtyard of the Death Syndicate Headquarters-
I strode through the courtyard as I saw about forty heavily armored mounted knights and ten light cavalry skirmishers all awaiting orders.
“Your orders are simply,” I sighed calmly, “All of the knights are to accompany me to Lunaris while the light cavalry are to marshal the rest our armies.”
The main goal was to recapture the Imperial Capital and then begin spreading out and retaking all of the old lands held by the Empire of the Moon…this would anger several of the more powerful city states including Kronos but it was all worth it…for in the end the Empire of the Moon would be reborn and I would be that much closer to having my sins absolved.
“We ride for the restoration of the empire!” I roared as my cavalry thundered through the gate.
It would take us a month to reach Lunaris without magical aid…but I would march my soldiers to exhaustion if need be. I mounted my Kirin and as the gates opened my forces charged through them…the light cavalry quickly broke off and headed in different directions but my forces continued our ride south…eventually we would hit the coast where we would take ships and sail to the east where we would then land within miles of the city. If all went as planned the rest of my army should have already arrived or be very near…and then we would-
“My lord!” one of the knights yelled pulling me from my thoughts…there standing in front of me was Aranos and several guardsmen armed with swords and bucklers.
“I don’t have time to grind you underneath my heel right now Aranos,” I snarled, “So why don’t you get out of my way before we ride over your?”
“I will not let your sacking of Kronos stand!” he yelled defiantly.
“If I had sacked Kronos you wouldn’t have a single coin left in the city,” I laughed, “So why don’t you return to the city and stick your face back into your dragon’s bosom.”
“Do dragons even have bosoms?” Morvain whispered to Galthim who shrugged.
“H-h-how dare you!” he shouted his face becoming beet red, “I should blast you off that damn horse!”
“Oh he’s not a damn horse,” I cooed rubbing Luvain’s armored neck, “He’s a proud Kirin.”
“I don’t care what you call that damn nag!” Aranos shouted.
“You’re really starting to piss me off,” I hissed angrily, “and how do you expect to oppose us because A. I at least equal you in skill, B. I have far more experience in both magic and physical combat, C. I’m backed by professional soldiers, and D. we outnumber you.”
“I already know that your strength is not your own,” he snarled charging up an orb of ice energy, “So why don’t you stand down.”
He launched the attack at me but as it streaked towards me I raised my hand and launched ball of flame which intercepted Aranos’s and canceled out both attacks.
“If that’s all the strength you can muster then your weaker than I thought,” I taunted, “I will admit though that you’re skilled but I’ve had a thousand years to hone my skills…and unlike you I don’t forbid myself access to the forbidden arts…now witness as terror descends upon you!”
I raised my hand and a purple pentagram appeared in my palm and began radiating power…the guards gathered with Aranos began to panic and act irrationally as their worst fears came to life right in front of their eyes…Aranos was resisting but I could see the pain in his eyes.
“Surrender Aranos,” I laughed, “I know you are strong but are you really willing to sacrifice those who follow you…are you willing to do what is necessary to achieve victory!”
The Pentagram in my hand turned from purple to red and his soldiers became consumed by blinding rage and began fighting among themselves.
“I will not surrender!” he snarled.
“Fine then,” I hissed as the pentagram on my hand turned a bright acidic green, “Watch as you men die in agony.”
His men began screaming in agony as their bodies erupted in weeping sores, vomiting, and crying tears of blood.
“I’ve shown you three of the seven forbidden arts,” I hissed as his men collapsed screaming in agony, “Despair, Rage, and Pestilence…if you wish I can show you the last four.”
“Please make it stop!” one of the guardsmen cried out, “Please make it stop.”
“Aranos…is your pride really worth these men’s lives?” I inquired, “Is your pride worth mothers losing their sons, children their fathers, wives their husbands?”
“Please let it stop,” one of the men wailed before grabbing Aranos, “Please don’t let me die here…I-I want to go home…I-I want to see my son…please…don’t let me die.”
“Aranos you accuse me of being a monster but here you are letting these men die when it’s in your power to stop them,” I stated the brightness of the pentagram intensifying along with the screams of the guards.
“STOP!” Aranos yelled despair filling his voice as he fell to his knees, “I…I surrender.”
As he said this the pentagram glowed with a brilliant white light and his soldiers were cleansed of their wounds and ailments but had passed out from the pain.
“We are more alike than you realize Aranos,” I smiled as my forces marched by him…this comment drew a glare from him, “We both follow what we believe to be the right path…we travel the world seeking knowledge to aid those we care about…we are both willing to sacrifice ourselves for our goals…but that is where the similarities end…you are unwilling to sacrifice your men…I am not…I will sacrifice them in a heartbeat if it means achieving victory.”
“We are nothing alike,” he whispered.
“You could easily become what I am Aranos,” I stated looking at him, “In you is a thirst for power…an obsession for it…you had best beware where you quench this thirst for no matter how noble your goals there are those who will twist them to suit their purpose…If you wish to learn what it means to truly wield power than meet me at the southern sea four leagues east of the port city of Rama…their you shall witness what true power is.”
With that I and my riders rode off leaving Aranos there to ponder my words…We would arrive at the port within days…and whether or not Aranos joined us would be up to fate

Plot:
An well organized human city named Kornos stands at the base of a long extinguished volcano, connected to the mountain chain called Chain of Fire, the fertile grounds and easy access to the river has attracted colonist from the whole region of Distaria, a vast mostly flat continent. The city is considered mostly secure despite the obvious but usually non threatening presence of dragons and other minor beast, residing on the mountains not too far from the city, or the Evergreen forest that flank it. The city is mostly supplied by the commercial docks and numerous caravan that travel the Grand Way, a well maintained road that circumvent nearly the whole region.

Guidelines:
-Differently from others stories, i want this one to be descriptive, especially about the erotica act, i don't pretend perfection nor a porno screenplay, but try to write what's happening to the character involved, avoid: i get in, ah ah, release, done

-Minimum age for human protagonist is 16, no specific limitation for critters

-Interspecies relation are encouraged, when possible, remember that most citizens try to ignore the small phenomenon

-Try to use proper grammar and spelling, i don't pretend perfection, but please try

-If possible write at least 1500+ characters per chapter, excluding choice specific chapters, i won't delete if less, but try to maintain this standard

-Shrinking is allowed only for the dragon and bigger critters within limits, a dragon can become medium pony sized, not less, human and small critter can't shrink, ever

-Growing is not allowed, recovering original shape is

-Only soft Vore, and only from a full sized dragon or other big critters

-Characters and protagonist can die, just try to make sense, and when possible give an escape chance, Vore always result in death

-Magic is allowed for both human and dragons, resurrection while possible is a very difficult and uncertain procedure, not from Vore or body disintegration/tuned to ashes etc. the body must be mostly intact

-Rape is allowed, just try to give it purpose/plot

Addendum: Shrinking below the above mentioned limit is allowed if a specific empower potion has been taken by the creature, human can't still shrink. In those cases the creature can become as small as a fairy but...only for a short time and never smaller nor it will ever try to insert itself in any living being "hole".

-Transformation are allowed but they must be justified and unless the plot requires it, rare. Remember that this interactive is not based on transformation but on the "life" of the various protagonist, so please no absurd things.
